speaker: THREEPIO

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: They've shut down the main reactor. We'll be destroyed for sure. This is madness!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: We're doomed.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: There'll be no escape for the Princess this time.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: What's that?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Artoo-Detoo, where are you?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: At last! Where have you been?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: They're heading in this direction.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: What are we going to do? We'll be sent to the spice mine of Kessel or smashed into who knows what!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Wait a minute, where are you going?

speaker: IMPERIAL OFFICER
combinedline: The Death Star plans are not in the main computer.

speaker: VADER
combinedline: Where are those transmissions you intercepted?

speaker: VADER
combinedline: What have you done with those plans?

speaker: REBEL OFFICER
combinedline: We intercepted no transmissions. This is a consular ship. Were on a diplomatic mission.

speaker: VADER
combinedline: If this is a consular ship... where is the ambassador?

speaker: VADER
combinedline: Commander, tear this ship apart until you've found those plans and bring me the passangers. I want them alive!

speaker: TROOPER
combinedline: There's one! Set for stun! She'll be all right. Inform Lord Vader we have a prisoner.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Hey, you're not permitted in there. It's restricted. You'll be deactivated for sure.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Don't call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight glob of grease! Now come out before somebody sees you.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Secret mission? What plans? What are you talking about? I'm not getting in there!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I'm going to regret this.

speaker: CHIEF PILOT
combinedline: There goes another one.

speaker: CAPTAIN
combinedline: Hold your fire. There are no life forms. It must have short-circuited.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: That's funny, the damage doesn't look as bad from out here.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Are you sure this thing is safe?

speaker: LEIA
combinedline: Darth Vader, Only you could be so bold. The Imperial Senate will not sit still for this, when they hear you've attacked a diplomatic...

speaker: VADER
combinedline: Don't act so surprised, Your Highness. You weren't on any mercy mission this time. Several transmissions were beamed to this ship by Rebel spies. I want to know what happened to the plans they sent you.

speaker: LEIA
combinedline: I don't know what you're talking about. I'm a member of the Imperial Senate on a diplomatic mission to Alderaan...

speaker: VADER
combinedline: You are a part of the Rebel Alliance... and a traitor. Take her away!

speaker: COMMANDER
combinedline: Holding her is dangerous. If word of this gets out, it could generate sympathy for the Rebellion and the senate.

speaker: VADER
combinedline: I have traced the Rebel spies to her. Now she is my only link to find their secret base!

speaker: COMMANDER
combinedline: She'll die before she tells you anything.

speaker: VADER
combinedline: Leave that to me. Send a distress signal and then inform the senate that all aboard were killed!

speaker: SECOND OFFICER
combinedline: Lord Vader, the battle station plans are not aboard this ship! And no transmissions were made. An escape pod was jettisoned during the fighting, but no life forms were aboard.

speaker: VADER
combinedline: She must have hidden the plans in the escape pod. Send a detachment down to retrieve them. See to it personally, Commander. There'll be no one to stop us this time.

speaker: COMMANDER
combinedline: Yes, sir.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: How did we get into this mess? I really don't know how. We seem to be made to suffer. It's our lot in life.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I've got to rest before I fall apart. My joints are almost frozen.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: What a desolate place this is.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Where do you think you're going?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Well, I'm not going that way. It's much too rocky. This way is much easier.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: What makes you think there are settlements over there?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Don't get technical with me.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: What mission? What are you talking about? I've had just about enough of

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: you! Go that way! You'll be malfunctioning within a day, you nearsighted scrap pile!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: And don't let me catch you following me begging for help, because you won't get it.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: No more adventures. I'm not going that way.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: That malfunctioning little twerp. This is all his fault! He tricked me into going this way, but he'll do no better. Wait, what's that? A transport! I'm saved!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Over here! Hey! Hey! Help! Please, help!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Artoo?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Artoo-Detoo! It is you! It is you!

speaker: FIRST TROOPER
combinedline: Someone was in the pod. The tracks go off in this direction.

speaker: SECOND TROOPER
combinedline: Look, sir-- droids.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: We stopped. Wake up! Wake up!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: We're doomed.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Do you think they'll melt us down?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Don't shoot! Don't shoot!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Will this never end?

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: All right, fine, let's go

speaker: BERU
combinedline: Luke? Luke? Luke, tell Uncle if he gets a translator to be sure it speaks Bocce.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Doesn't look like we have much of a choice but I'll remind him.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Yeah, I'll take the red one No, not that one

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: You. I suppose you're programmed for etiquette and protocol

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Protocol? Why, it's my primary function sir. I am well-versed in all the customs.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: I have no need for a protocol droid.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Of course you haven't, Sir -- not in an environment such as this -- that is why I have been programmed....

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: What I really need is a droid WHO understands the binary language of moisture vaporators.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Vaporators! Sir -- My first job was programming binary load lifters... Very similar to your vaporators In most respects...

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Can you speak Bocce?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Of course I can, sir. It's like a second language to me... I'm as fluent...

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: All right shut up!

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: I'll take this one.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Shutting up, sir.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Luke, take these two over to the garage, will you? I want them cleaned up before dinner.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: But I was going into Toshi Station to pick up some power converters...

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: You can waste time with your friends when your chores are done. Now come on, get to it!

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: All right, come on!

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: And the red one, come on. Well, come on, Red, let's go.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Uncle Owen...

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Yeah?

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: This R2 unit has a bad motivator. Look!

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Hey, what're you trying to push on us?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Excuse me, sir, but that R2 unit is in prime condition. A real bargain.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Uncle Owen...

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Yeah?

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: What about that one?

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: What about that blue one? We'll take that one.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I'm quite sure you'll be very pleased with that one, sir. He really is in first-class condition. I've worked with him before. Here he comes.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Okay, let's go.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Now, don't you forget this! Why I should stick my neck out for you is quite beyond my capacity!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Thank the maker! This oil bath is going to feel so good. I've got such a bad case of dust contamination, I can barely move!

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: It just isn't fair. Oh, Biggs is right. I'm never gonna get out of here!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Is there anything I might do to help?

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Well, not unless you can alter time, speed up the harvest, or teleport me off this rock!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I don't think so, sir. I'm only a droid and not very knowledgeable about such things. Not on this planet, anyways. As a matter of fact, I'm not even sure which planet I'm on.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Well, if there's a bright center to the universe, you're on the planet that it's farthest from.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I see, sir.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Uh, you can call me Luke.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I see, sir Luke.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Just Luke.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: And I am See-Threepio, human-cyborg relations, and this is my counterpart, Artoo-Detoo.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Hello.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: You got a lot of carbon scoring here. It looks like you boys have seen a lot of action.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: With all we've been through, sometimes I'm amazed we're in as good condition as we are, what with the Rebellion and all.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: You know of the Rebellion against the Empire?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: That's how we came to be in your service, if you take my meaning, sir.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Have you been in many battles?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Several, I think. Actually, there's not much to tell. I'm not much more than an interpreter, and not very good at telling stories. Well, not at making them interesting, anyways.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Well, my little friend, you've got something jammed in here real good. Were you on a cruiser or...

speaker: LEIA
combinedline: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: What's this?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: What is what?!? He asked you a question... What is that?

speaker: LEIA
combinedline: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope. Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Oh, he says it's nothing, sir. Merely a malfunction. Old data. Pay it no mind.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Who is she? She's beautiful.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I'm afraid I'm not quite sure...

speaker: LEIA
combinedline: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi...

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I think she was a passenger on our last voyage. A person of some importance, sir -- I believe. Our captain was attached to...

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Is there more to this recording?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Behave yourself, Artoo. You're going to get us in trouble. It's all right, you can trust him. He's our new master.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: He says he's the property of Obi-Wan Kenobi, a resident of these parts. And it's a private message for him. Quite frankly, sir I don't know what he's talking about. Our last master was Captain Antilles, but with all we've been through, this little R2 unit has become a bit eccentric.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Obi-Wan Kenobi? I wonder if he means old Ben Kenobi?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I beg your pardon, sir, but do you know what he's talking about?

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Well, I don't know anyone named Obi-Wan, but old Ben lives out beyond the dune sea. He's kind of a strange old hermit.

speaker: LEIA
combinedline: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi... you're my only hope

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: I wonder who she is. It sounds like she's in trouble. I'd better play back the whole thing.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: He says the restraining bolt has short circuited his recording system. He suggests that if you remove the bolt, he might be able to play back the entire recording.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: H'm? Oh, yeah, well, I guess you're too small to run away on me if I take this off! Okay. There you go.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Wait a minute. Where'd she go? Bring her back! Play back the entire message.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: What message? The one you've just been playing.

speaker: R2D2
combinedline: SQUEEK

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: The one you're carrying inside your rusty innards!

speaker: BERU
combinedline: Luke? Luke!

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: All right, I'll be right there, Aunt Beru.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I'm sorry, sir, but he appears to have picked up a slight flutter.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Here. See what you can do with him. I'll be right back.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Just you reconsider playing that message for him.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: No, I don't think he likes you at all.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: No, I don't like you either.

speaker: R2D2
combinedline: SADBEEP

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: You know, I think that R2 unit we bought might have been stolen.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: What makes you think that?

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Well, I stumbled across a recording while I was cleaning him. He says he belongs to someone called Obi-Wan Kenobi. I thought he might have meant old Ben. Do you know what he's talking about? I wonder if he's related to Ben.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: That wizard's just a crazy old man. Tomorrow I want you to take that R2 unit into Anchorhead to have its memory erased. That'll be the end of it. It belongs to us now.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: But what if this Obi-Wan comes looking for him?

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: He won't, I don't think he exists any more. He died about the same time as your father.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: He knew my father?

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: I told you to forget it. Your only concern is to prepare the new droids for tomorrow. In the morning I want them up there on the south ridge working on those condensers.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Yes, sir. I think those new droids are going to work out fine. In fact, I, was also thinking about our agreement about me staying on another season.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: And if these new droids do work out, I want to transmit my application to the Academy this year.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: You mean the next semester before harvest?

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Sure, there're more than enough droids.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Harvest is when I need you the most. Only one more season. This year we'll make enough on the harvest that I'll be able to hire some more hands. And then you can go to the Academy next year. You must understand I need you here, Luke.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: But it's a whole 'nother year.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: It's only one more season.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Yeah, that's what you said when Biggs and Tank left.

speaker: BERU
combinedline: Where are you going?

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: It looks like I'm going nowhere. I have to finish cleaning those droids.

speaker: BERU
combinedline: Owen, he can't stay here forever. Most of his friends have gone. It means so much to him.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: I'll make it up to him next year. I promise.

speaker: BERU
combinedline: Luke's just not a farmer, Owen. He has too much of his father in him.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: That's what I'm afraid of.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: What are you doing hiding back there?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: It wasn't my fault, sir. Please don't deactivate me. I told him not to go, but he's faulty, malfunctioning; kept babbling on about his mission.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Oh, no!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: That R2 unit has always been a problem. These astro-droids are getting quite out of hand. Even I can't understand their logic at times.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: How could I be so stupid? He's nowhere in sight. Blast it!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Pardon me, sir, but couldn't we go after him?

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: It's too dangerous with all the Sandpeople around. We'll have to wait until morning.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Luke, I'm shutting the power down

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: All right, I'll be there in a few minutes.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Boy, am I gonna get it. You know that little droid is going to cause me a lot of trouble.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Oh, he excels at that, sir.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Luke? Luke? Luke?

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Have you seen Luke this morning?

speaker: BERU
combinedline: He said he had some things to do before he started today, so he left early.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Did he take those two new droids with him?

speaker: BERU
combinedline: I think so.

speaker: OWEN LARS
combinedline: Well, he'd better have those units in the south range repaired by midday or there'll be hell to pay!

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Look it, there's a droid on the scanner. dead ahead. Might be our little Artoo unit... hit the accelerator.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Hey, just where do you think you're going?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Master Luke here is your rightful owner. We'll have no more of this Obi-Wan Kenobi gibberish...

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: and don't talk to me about your mission, either. You're fortunate he doesn't blast you into a million pieces right here.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: No, it's all right, but I think we'd better go.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: What's wrong with him now?

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: there are several creatures approaching from the southeast.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Sandpeople!

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Or worse! Come on, let's go have a look. Come on.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Well, There are two Banthas down there but I don't see any... wait a second, they're Sandpeople all right. I can see one of them now.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Hello there!

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Come here my little friend. Don't be afraid.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Don't worry, he'll be all right.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Rest easy, son, you've had a busy day. You're fortunate to be all in one piece.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Ben? Ben Kenobi! Boy, am I glad to see you!

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: The Jundland wastes are not to be traveled lightly.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Tell me young Luke, what brings you out this far?

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: This little droid!

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: I think he's searching for his former master... I've never seen such devotion in a droid before...

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: He claims to be the property of an Obi-Wan Kenobi. Is he a relative of yours? Do you know who

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: he's talking about?

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Obi-Wan Kenobi... Obi-Wan. Now that's a name I've not heard in a long time... a long time.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: I think my uncle knew him. He said he was dead.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Oh, he's not dead, not yet.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: You know him!

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Well of course I know him. He's me!

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: I haven't gone by the name of Obi-Wan since oh, before you were born.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Then the droid does belong to you.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Don't seem to remember ever owning a droid.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Very interesting... I think we better get indoors. The Sandpeople are easily startled but they'll soon be back and in greater numbers.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Threepio!

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Where am I? I must have taken a bad step...

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Can you stand? We've got to get out of here before the Sandpeople return.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: I don't think I can make it. You go on, Master Luke. There's no sense in you risking yourself on my account. I'm done for.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: No, you're not. What kind of talk is that?

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Quickly... they're on the move.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: No, my father didn't fight in the wars. He was a navigator on a spice freighter.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: That's what your uncle told you. He didn't hold with your father's ideals. Thought he should have stayed here and not gotten involved.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: You fought in the Clone Wars?

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Yes, I was once a Jedi Knight the same as your father.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: I wish I'd known him.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: He was the best star-pilot in the galaxy, and a cunning warrior. I understand you've become quite a good pilot yourself. And he was a good friend. Which reminds me... I have something here for you.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Your father wanted you to have this when you were old enough, but your uncle wouldn't allow it. He feared you might follow old Obi-Wan on some damned-fool idealistic crusade like your father did.

speaker: THREEPIO
combinedline: Sir, if you'll not be needing me, I'll close down for awhile.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Sure, go ahead.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: What is it?

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Your fathers lightsaber. This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster. An elegant weapon for a more civilized age. For over a thousand generations the Jedi Knights were the guardians of peace and justice in the Old Republic. Before the dark times, before the Empire.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: How did my father die?

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who was a pupil of mine until he turned to evil, helped the Empire hunt down and destroy the Jedi Knights. He betrayed and murdered your father. Now the Jedi are all but extinct. Vader was seduced by the dark side of the Force.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: The Force?

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Well, the Force is what gives a Jedi his power. It's an energy field created by all living things. It surrounds us and penetrates us. It binds the galaxy together.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Now, let's see if we can't figure out what you are, my little friend. And where you come from.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: I saw part of the message he was...

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: I seem to have found it.

speaker: LEIA
combinedline: General Kenobi, years ago you served my father in the Clone Wars. Now he begs you to help him in his struggle against the Empire. I regret that I am unable to present my father's request to you in person, but my ship has fallen under attack and I'm afraid my mission to bring you to Alderaan has failed. I have placed information vital to the survival of the Rebellion into the memory systems of this R2 unit. My father will know how to retrieve it. You must see this droid safely delivered to him on Alderaan. This is our most desperate hour. Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi, you're my only hope.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: You must learn the ways of the Force if you're to come with me to Alderaan.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Alderaan? I'm not going to Alderaan. I've got to get home. It's late, I'm in for it as it is.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: I need your help, Luke. She needs your help. I'm getting too old for this sort of thing.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: I can't get involved! I've got work to do! It's not that I like the Empire. I hate it! But there's nothing I can do about it right now. It's such a long way from here.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: That's your uncle talking.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: God, my uncle. How am I ever going to explain this?

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: Learn about the Force, Luke.

speaker: LUKE
combinedline: Look, I can take you as far as Anchorhead. You can get a transport there to Mos Eisley or wherever you're going.

speaker: OBI-WAN
combinedline: You must do what you feel is right, of course.

speaker: TAGGE
combinedline: Until this battle station is fully operational we are vulnerable. The Rebel Alliance is too well-equipped. They're more dangerous than you realize.

speaker: MOTTI
combinedline: Dangerous to your starfleet, Commander, not to this battle station!

speaker: TAGGE
combinedline: The Rebellion will continue to gain a support in the Imperial Senate as long as....

speaker: TARKIN
combinedline: The Imperial Senate will no longer be of any concern to us. I've just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the council permanently. The last remnants of the Old Republic have been swept away.

speaker: TAGGE
combinedline: That's impossible! How will the Emperor maintain control without the bureaucracy?

speaker: TARKIN
combinedline: The regional governors now have direct control over territories. Fear will keep the local systems in line. Fear of this battle station.

speaker: TAGGE
combinedline: And what of the Rebellion? If the Rebels have obtained a complete technical readout of this station, it is possible, however unlikely, that they might find a weakness and exploit it.

speaker: VADER
combinedline: The plans you refer to will soon be back in our hands.

speaker: MOTTI
combinedline: Any attack made by the Rebels against this station would be a useless gesture, no matter what technical data they've obtained. This station is now the ultimate power in the universe. I suggest we use it!

speaker: VADER
combinedline: Don't be too proud of this technological terror you've constructed. The ability to destroy a planet is insignificant next to the power of the Force.

speaker: MOTTI
combinedline: Don't try to frighten us with your sorcerer's ways, Lord Vader. Your sad devotion to that ancient religion has not helped you conjure up the stolen data tapes or given you clairvoyance enough to find the Rebel's hidden fort...

speaker: VADER
